GET /api.description: serves up a json representation of all the available endpoints of the api

GET /api/topics.description: serves an array of all topics

GET /api/articles.description: serves an array of all articles in descending order from created_at

GET /api/articles/:article_id.description: serves an article object which contains the requested article when given a valid article number

article.title: Living in the shadow of a great man
article.author: butter_bridge

GET /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: serves an array which contains each comment as an object, this is from the article id given

comments.body: What do you see? I have no idea where this will lead us. This place I speak of, is known as the Black Lodge
comments.author: icellusedkars

comments.body: I am 100% sure that we're not completely sure
comments.author: butter_bridge

GET /api/users.description: serves an array which contains each user as an object

GET /api/users/:username.description: serves an object which contains the user data when given a valid username

POST /api/articles/:article_id/comments.description: an existing user can post a new comment, which the return will be confirmation of the new comment

PATCH /api/articles/:article_id.description: updates an existing article with a votes number within the body, serves an object called update with an array which contains the updated object

update.title: Sony Vaio; or, The Laptop
update.author: icellusedkars
update.body: The book description will go here

DELETE /api/comments/:comment_id.description: deletes an existing comment when given a comment id, no object is returned
